Physical Exam: General appearance and vital signs (temperature, pulse, respiration, blood pressure)
Justification: To assess for any signs of anemia or other nutritional deficiencies.

Physical Exam: Head and neck examination (including thyroid palpation)
Justification: To assess for any signs of thyroid dysfunction or other endocrine abnormalities.

Physical Exam: Mental status examination (including mood, affect, and cognition)
Justification: To assess for any signs of depression or other mental health conditions.

Physical Exam: Musculoskeletal examination (including range of motion and palpation of muscles and joints)
Justification: To assess for any signs of musculoskeletal problems.

Physical Exam: Neurological examination (including gait, coordination, and reflexes)
Justification: To assess for any signs of neurological problems.
